title: In the Mood for Love
creator_credit: Paradis Films, Orly Films, Universal Pictures, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Wong Kar-wai and William Chang
brief_description: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other, but resist repeating the betrayals of their partners.

constellations_primary.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_primary.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

constellations_other.name: Into a World of Colour
constellations_other.description: Filmmakers have been using colour as a method of storytelling since the first moving pictures. Colour can be used to signify emotion, intensify drama or to create a strong visual aesthetic.

creator_credit_for_label: Paradis Films, Orly Films, Universal Pictures, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Wong Kar-wai and William Chang
description: Hong Kong, 1962: Chow Mo-Wan (Tony Leung Chiu Wai) and Su Li-Zhen (Maggie Cheung Man Yuk) move into neighboring apartments on the same day. Their encounters are formal and polite—until a discovery about their spouses creates an intimate bond between them.
